intro: Polycodium multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered polycodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough, textured surface. Polycodium multiflorum is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
